item.title: Waste van abandoned in parking bay, 5th February
item.description:
It has been in the street for around 3 weeks now and doesn’t appear to have moved. It is parked near the junction of Beechhill and Gourock Road. It is hard to see if it contains waste as it is very tall.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Beechhill Road, Eltham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole Lodge Hill Welling, 5th February
item.description:
Tuesday evening 03/02/2026 I struck a deep pothole on Lodge Hill. The following Wednesday morning I found my nearside front tyre was flat. I replaced with the spare and took the car to Dartford Tyres Thursday Morning. It was dicovered that the tyre had suststained impact damage causing a split in the sidewall. The rim had also been dented. The tyre had to be replaced, at a cost of £45.82. The rim, although damaged, was considered servicable. I noticed on my return home Thursday afetrnoon the pothole had been repaired. Please advise how to submit a claim. Brian West 31 Denton Road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Totnes Road, East Wickham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Uneven footpath, 5th February
item.description:
PLEASE NOTE, AFTER SEVERAL REPAIRS TO THE FOOTPATH/DRIVEWAY OUTSIDE Nos 08 &10 (over past few years)BOWFORD AVE DA7 4ST, WE ARE LEFT WITH AN AREA THAT ALWAYS HAS A LARGE PUDDLE (that freezes over in cold weather), No 10 HAS AN 94 YEARS RESIDENT THAT I'M TERRIFIED WILL HAVE A FALL . I WOULD BE VERY GRATEFUL IF THIS PROBLEM COULD BE INVESTIGATED , AND MADE GOOD . VERY MANY THANKS. T.DULIEU. 8 BOWFORD AVE. DA7 4ST. 07860466114. tel17@me.com

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bowford Avenue, West Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken paving slabs outside number 2 honeyden road, 5th February
item.description:
Broken and uneven paving slabs outside number 2 honeyden road, this was reported a little while ago and the resident got advised that they are not broken enough to be replaced but he has advised with bad weather (rain) he walks over this as he cant go any other way and all the rain water goes over his feet, ruining his trainers. He would like these replaced please.

item.title: Large and deep pothole/broken road surface on road close to house number 78., 5th February
item.description:

item.title: Lighting not on in a large section of the park, 5th February
item.description:
For more than a month the lights in a large section of Burgess Park have not been on. This route through the park is a key cycle route and also it is a direct connection from the 1st Place nursery in Burgess Park and Camberwell. Please provide an update, I really hope that the lights can be turned back on soon to make it safer to walk through the park in the evening.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 42, Southampton Way, Camberwell, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
